name: “Pobai” Antiaris toxicaria
description: A tall deciduous tree known for its toxic latex. Found in tropical forests and used in traditional medicine.

name: “Si Siet Thet” Sappanwood
description: A medicinal shrub used for red dye and herbal remedies. Common in Southeast Asia.

name: “Waa” Java Plum
description: Evergreen tropical tree bearing edible purple fruits. Widely cultivated in Asia.

name: “Yang Sian” Dipterocarpus tuberculatus
description: A large dipterocarp tree native to Southeast Asian forests. Important for timber and resin.

name: “Por Hu Chang” Hibiscus macrophyllus
description: A broad-leaved shrub native to Thai forests, with medicinal uses.

name: “Sai” Banyan Tree
description: A majestic fig tree with aerial roots. Considered sacred in many cultures.

name: “Luead Kwai” Bischofia javanica
description: Fast-growing tree with reddish wood. Often found in tropical lowland forests.

name: “Tao Ngu Hao” Aristolochia tagala
description: A climbing vine known for its snake-like flower patterns. Used in traditional remedies.

name: “Champi Pa” Wild Champak
description: A forest magnolia with fragrant white flowers. Native to mountainous forest zones.

name: “Yam Hom” Wild Ylang-Ylang
description: Aromatic tree with flowers used in perfumes and oils.

name: “Kaprao Pa” Wild Holy Basil
description: A wild form of basil with strong aroma and medicinal properties.

name: “Kritsana” Eaglewood
description: Valuable tree known for producing agarwood, used in incense and perfumes.

name: “Nonn Khi Kwai” Acalypha wilkesiana
description: A colorful-leaved ornamental shrub, used in hedges and landscaping.

name: Shorea roxburghii
description: A high-value timber tree found in dry dipterocarp forests.

name: “Ya Kha” Cogon Grass
description: A tough perennial grass common in disturbed forest areas. Used for thatching and erosion control.
